title: Student Engagement Strategy Design for Enhancing Pre-Service Teachers' Mathematical Thinking in Remote Education Settings

context.prior_knowledge: Basic experience with online learning platforms and understanding of secondary-level mathematics concepts (equations, functions, geometry, probability, statistics)
context.additional_context: Project-based course where pre-service teachers participate in math education content development, aiming to improve learners' computational and problem-solving abilities. Special emphasis on designing activities that enhance algebraic thinking and spatial reasoning.

learning_goals: Propose mathematics instructional design strategies applying Chickering and Gamson’s Seven Principles of Good Practice in remote education (e.g., asynchronous discussion forums for equation-solving processes)
Develop student engagement strategies reflecting synchronous/asynchronous digital media characteristics (e.g., real-time graph interpretation activities in video classes)

Within six months, learners analyze mathematical profiles (learning styles, strengths/weaknesses, interests) of three peers, develop ≥3 customized lesson designs applying tailored pedagogies (e.g., visual aids for geometry, real-life problems for probability, collaborative learning for statistics), and achieve ≥80% satisfaction in peer reviews and instructor feedback
Conduct ≥3 cycles of peer feedback and self-reflection through project-based assessments (e.g., incorporating quantitative/qualitative evaluations into calculus lesson designs)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
